title: Font Identification?
content:
There’s this British band called Travis that uses this interesting sans-serif font. The “A” & “V” tend to bend into one another. And the “T”/”H” interact interestingly as well. I’m not sure if they’re just using an italicized version or not, but I’d really like to identify what font it is that they use. Here’s a few links to google images:

[http://www.galeon.com/allmusic/caratulas/t/Travis-The\_Invisible\_Band-Fro...](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503105915/http:/www.galeon.com/allmusic/caratulas/t/Travis-The_Invisible_Band-Frontal.jpg "http://www.galeon.com/allmusic/caratulas/t/Travis-The\_Invisible\_Band-Frontal.jpg")  
 [http://images.coveralia.com/audio/t/Travis-The\_Man\_Who-Frontal.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503105915/http:/images.coveralia.com/audio/t/Travis-The_Man_Who-Frontal.jpg "http://images.coveralia.com/audio/t/Travis-The\_Man\_Who-Frontal.jpg")

I’d really appreciate the help identifying the font.

Thanks!
author: Peripheral

comments.content:
Hey Lex,

Thanks for the identification. What did you mean by alternates though?
